body_html:
We currently don't support automatic type casting in pytorch, and while I agree allowing long types for the target would make it more similar to nll_loss, we would then have incompatibilities with mse_loss and others (which only accepts the same type as the input for the target). Also note that the target in bce_with_logits is not restricted to {0,1}, but instead [0,1].
Not sure what is the best to do here (leave as is, or change all losses where it makes sense to accept long as well for the target).

body:
We currently don't support automatic type casting in pytorch, and while I agree allowing long types for the target would make it more similar to `nll_loss`, we would then have incompatibilities with `mse_loss` and others (which only accepts the same type as the input for the target). Also note that the target in `bce_with_logits` is not restricted to `{0,1}`, but instead `[0,1]`.
Not sure what is the best to do here (leave as is, or change all losses where it makes sense to accept `long` as well for the target).
